intro: Knautia arvernica, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clustered, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Knautia arvernica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude conditions.
